summary.overview: The application is a web-based calculator that allows users to perform basic arithmetic operations. It includes a display screen for showing inputs and results, a set of buttons for numbers and operators, and a theme toggle feature to switch between dark and light modes.
summary.predefined_options: The calculator provides predefined buttons for numbers (0-9), operators (+, -, ×, ÷), and additional functions like clear, backspace, and parentheses.
summary.external_resources: The application uses an image as a favicon: './images/2344132.png'.
summary.external_js_libraries: No external JavaScript libraries are explicitly mentioned in the provided code.

requirements.description: When the user clicks a number button (0-9), the system appends the corresponding number to the display screen.
When the user clicks an operator button (+, -, ×, ÷), the system appends the corresponding operator to the display screen.
When the user clicks the clear button, the system clears all content from the display screen.
When the user clicks the backspace button, the system removes the last character from the display screen.
When the user clicks the equal button with a valid arithmetic expression on the display, the system evaluates the expression and updates the display with the result.
When the user clicks the equal button with an empty display, the system shows 'Empty!' on the display for 2 seconds before clearing it.
When the user clicks the theme toggle button, the system switches the calculator's theme between dark and light modes.
